question: In which nation "Nouabale-Ndoki National Park" is located?
explanation: Nouabale-Ndoki National Park is located in the Republic of Congo. It is a Ramsar Wetland. It is located within the Congo Basin. It houses forest elephants, great apes such as western lowland gorillas, chimpanzees and bongo. The national park vegetation is of pristine tropical rainforest and endangered species of mahoganies. It is drained by the Sangha Rivera and hence a part of the Sangha Tri-National Landscape. It hosts various conservation projects such as "The Elephant Listening Project", "Mondika Gorilla Project"; "The Goualougo Triangle Ape project".
